# Directors{-}

[Michael Haugh ](https://languages-cultures.uq.edu.au/profile/1498/michael-haugh)

![](images/michaelhaugh.jpeg){width=20%} 

Michael is Professor of Linguistics and Head of the School of Languages and Cultures. At LADAL, Michael is supervising the activities of LADAL and promoting its activities across Australia. His research interests lie primarily in the field of pragmatics, with a focus to date on analysing face, (im)politeness, teasing and humour, indirectness, and intention. He works with recordings and transcriptions of naturally occuring spoken interactions, as well as data from digitally-mediated forms of communications. He has been involved in the establishment of the [Australian National Corpus](http://www.ausnc.org.au), and is interested in further developing methods in corpus-assisted pragmatics.


[Martin Schweinberger](https://languages-cultures.uq.edu.au/profile/4295/martin-schweinberger)

![](images/martinschweinberger.jpeg){width=20%}

Martin is a language data scientist with a PhD in English linguistics and he is specialized in corpus linguistics, quantitative analyses, computational modeling, and visualization of linguistic data. His research focuses on language variation and change, determinants of language use and linguistic variability, as well as language acquisition.He is currently a postdoctoral research fellow in Language Technology at the School of Languages and Cultures where he has established LADAL. He is directing the activities at LADAL, creating content, and supervising the team members.
